author: BBC News
description: Manchester Arena bomber Salman Abedi's connections with Libya are being closely investigated.
title: Manchester attack: The Libya-jihad connection

author: By Chris Greenwood, Sam Greenhill and Ian Drury for the Daily Mail
description: Mustafa Graf appeared alongside elders at Didsbury Mosque condemning the atrocity, but was in Libya during the 2011 revolution. He's the imam of Salman Abedi's mosque.
title: Manchester killer's imam 'filmed fighting with militants in Libya'

author: By Jake Wallis Simons, Associate Global Editor, In Manchester, Chris Pleasance and Reuters
description: Hashem Abedi, 20, the younger brother of Manchester bomber Salman (pictured right), has been arrested in Tripoli, the capital of Libya, over suspected links to ISIS, police say.
title: Manchester bomber's younger brother is arrested in Libya

author: By Sam Greenhill, Andrew Malone, Larisa Brown And Neil Sears For The Daily Mail
description: Salman Abedi is believed to have fought alongside jihadis on the front line in eastern Libya in 2014 before being injured and taken to Turkey for treatment using a false passport.
title: Manchester bomber 'injured in Libya fighting with jihadis'

description: Authorities in Libya arrest the younger brother of Salman Abedi, the suspected suicide bomber who killed 22 people and wounded scores at an Ariana Grande concert in Manchester.
title: Abedi's brother, father arrested in Libya amid hunt for Manchester bomb-maker

author: Jack Montgomery
description: Salman Abedi returned to Britain from Libya just days before carrying out his deadly attack, and is thought to have travelled to Syria, too.
title: Salman Abedi Flew from Libya Days Before Attack, Travelled to Syria

author: Paul Cruickshank
description: As UK security services investigate what led Salman Abedi, a 22-year-old-British national of Libyan descent, to carry out the deadliest attack on British soil since the London bombings, a key line of inquiry will be what he got up to during the three weeks he spent in Libya before the attack.
title: Manchester attack: Why the Libya connection matters

description: More than 30 migrants, most of them toddlers, were reported to have drowned on Wednesday after the boat carrying them from the coast of Libya listed and flung them into the sea.
title: More than 30 migrants, 'most toddlers', drown off coast of Libya

author: Barbara Starr, CNN Pentagon Correspondent
description: Salman Abedi, the 22-year-old alleged Manchester bomber, traveled to Libya for three weeks, returning to the UK only days before launching his attack, according US military officials assigned to Africa Command.
title: US officials: Manchester suspect spent 3 weeks in Libya prior to attack

author: Ahmed Aboulenein
description: Egyptian fighter jets carried out strikes on Friday directed at camps in Libya which Cairo says have been training militants who killed dozens of Christians earlier in the day.
title: Egypt launches air raids on Libya after Christians killed
